source_caption_data.pre_caption: This video presents an extreme wide, static shot of a desert landscape, with the camera positioned at a low angle. The foreground, occupying the bottom of the frame, consists of dry earth, green desert shrubs, and a few saguaro cacti. In the middle ground, a range of rocky mountains extends across the scene. The background is initially divided, with a massive, brownish-orange dust storm on the left and a stormy blue sky with white clouds on the right. The primary dynamic is the dust storm, which advances from the left side of the frame to the right, progressively obscuring the mountains in the middle ground. The storm continues its movement until it completely fills the frame, covering the mountains and the sky.

Return only the one-paragraph video description without Markdown formatting or introductory text.

First, specify the **shot size** based on the subject's size in the frame if major subjects are present. If the shot size is unclear, describe how much of the subject is visible. If no major subject exists (e.g., a scenery shot), describe the shot size in relation to the scenery.

If **shot size or spatial position** changes, describe how these transitions occur clearly, specifying both the **initial and final states**.

In addition, the human-written captions below already describe the subjects (if any) and the scenery in this video but do not capture their spatial composition and movements. A massive, orange-brown wall of dust, characteristic of a haboob, rapidly advances from the left, creating a stark contrast with the vibrant, stormy blue sky visible on the right and the white, billowing clouds above. The foreground features dry, brown earth with green desert shrubs and a few saguaro cacti. The sky is split, with the hazy, light-colored top of the dust cloud on the left and a stormy blue sky with white clouds on the right. The wall of dust moves steadily, eventually obscuring all of the mountains and sky as it progresses.**
